awd_titl_txt: In-Situ Thermal Stabilization of Soils Using Plasma         Arc Technology
awd_abstract_narration: The objective of this research is to evaluate the concept                       of using plasma torches that can effectively be operated in                     situ in a cased borehole surrounded by a geo-material                           medium. The plasma torch would be lowered to the bottom of                      a small diameter, cased borehole. By raising and operating                      the torch at progressively higher levels the borehole                           casing is rapidly melted opposite the plasma flame, and a                       column of soil (and/or a mixture of soil & waste) is heated                     and converted into a stabilized vertical mass. Successive                       (or simultaneous) operations in adjacent boreholes,                             properly spaced, would likewise stabilize an entire region.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
